description: A mass located within the bronchial airway.

attributes.name: Presence
attributes.description: Indicates whether the endobronchial mass is present or absent.

attributes.name: Status
attributes.description: The status of the endobronchial mass.

values.name: Increasing
values.description: The endobronchial mass is increasing in size.

values.name: Decreasing
values.description: The endobronchial mass is decreasing in size.

attributes.name: Location
attributes.description: The location of the endobronchial mass.

values.name: Specify location
values.description: Specify the location of the endobronchial mass.

values.name: None
values.description: No location specified for the endobronchial mass.

attributes.name: Size
attributes.description: The size of the endobronchial mass.

attributes.name: Shape
attributes.description: The shape of the endobronchial mass.

attributes.name: Airway Obstruction
attributes.description: Indicates whether there is airway obstruction associated with the endobronchial mass.

values.name: Present
values.description: There is airway obstruction associated with the endobronchial mass.

values.name: Absent
values.description: There is no airway obstruction associated with the endobronchial mass.

attributes.name: Distal Atelectasis or Consolidation
attributes.description: Indicates whether there is distal atelectasis or consolidation associated with the endobronchial mass.

values.name: Present
values.description: There is distal atelectasis or consolidation associated with the endobronchial mass.

values.name: Absent
values.description: There is no distal atelectasis or consolidation associated with the endobronchial mass.

attributes.name: Lymphadenopathy
attributes.description: Indicates whether there is lymphadenopathy associated with the endobronchial mass.

values.name: Present
values.description: There is lymphadenopathy associated with the endobronchial mass.

values.name: Absent
values.description: There is no lymphadenopathy associated with the endobronchial mass.
